title: Hitting the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog doesn't perform a search on Mac OS X
description: When using Eclipse 3.0 M2Build (id: 200307181617) on Mac OS X 10.2.6, hitting the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog does not trigger a search operation. To reproduce the issue, follow these steps: 1) Open the Find/Replace dialog (Edit -> Find/Replace). 2) Type in a search term into the text box. 3) Hit the Enter/Return key. Expected result: The search should be performed. Actual result: Nothing happens. The Enter/Return key should function as a shortcut for the 'Find' button in the dialog, triggering the search operation.
OB: The Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog should perform a search operation when pressed on Mac OS X.
EB: The Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog does not trigger a search operation when pressed on Mac OS X.
SR: Modify the Find/Replace dialog to execute the search operation when the Enter/Return key is pressed on Mac OS X.
